file_content.text: You should not be here any longer, Revanite.
You who have died and been reborn--stand before me now.
You who have reclaimed the ancient past--stand before me now.
You who have demonstrated power and wisdom to my followers--look upon the Master of the Order of Revan.
It is so.
What's all this about? I don't understand.
What's going on?
Are you too afraid to show your face?
You hiding from me?
Silence.
This is the end of your initiation and the beginning of your true journey. You will walk the path of Revan forevermore.
The enemies of the order will force you to move in shadows. But we shall keep your secrets safe--as you shall keep ours.
The time for subterfuge is over. Know me for who I am.
I thought the Master was a man.
You're the Master?
The ruse serves its purpose. Besides, it felt appropriate--Revan's own gender is unclear in many of our records.
Only a coward hides behind masks and holograms.
Enough tricks!
Even Revan walked in darkness sometimes. It is a... practical choice.
So, the puppet master is revealed.
At last we meet.
How do I know this isn't another disguise?
You could be a trick, too.
I have placed my trust in you. Place yours in me.
Glad to finally see the real deal.
At last we meet.
All that to meet up with you? I'm hardly impressed.
This is a letdown.
If I wanted you to be impressed, I would never have come to meet you.
I apologize for the deception, and for not meeting you sooner--but you must know how badly the Dark Council wants me dead.
The Order of Revan threatens everything the Dark Council prizes.
What makes the order such a threat?
What's so dangerous?
Why did you found the order in the first place?
What's the purpose of it all?
I stumbled upon the mysteries of Revan on Korriban, when I became a Sith. That started me down a terrible path.
Not very humble.
You've seen the power of Revan's path. Do you really still doubt?
Revan came to Dromund Kaas after being reborn. Some believe Revan died at the hands of our Emperor. I believe otherwise.
I believe Revan overthrew the Emperor and has sat secretly on the throne for three centuries. Aside from our order, only the Dark Council knows the truth.
You really think Revan replaced the Emperor?
Are you sure?
I do. It's the only way the puzzle pieces fit.
That seems unlikely.
You're completely mad, aren't you?
But that's crazy.
Could a madwoman have achieved so much power? Believe in me. Believe in the path of Revan.
I have heard whispers in the Citadel. For decades, the Emperor has been in seclusion; the Dark Council no longer speaks with him.
The only explanation is this: The Dark Council betrayed their leader and locked Emperor Revan away, seizing power for themselves. They seek to silence us because we know.
We shouldn't let them get away with this.
We have to do something.
We won't. It will take many years to free the Emperor, however, and first I need your help on a different matter.
They want to silence you because they think you're heretics.
You're being paranoid.
They do. But listing their many reasons for destroying us is pointless. I would ask for your help.
I think I've heard enough conspiracy theories.
This is absurd.
It's difficult, I know, to think that our great Emperor suffers. But I would ask you for your help.
My agents tell me that you met with a Sith named Sandor--a man who seeks to destroy the Revanites.
End his threat. Go to Sandor and tell him that you met the Revanite leader. Tell him that the leader is his own master, Darth Charnus.
Why would he believe me?
Will that work?
I begin to tire of these deceptions.
Enough lying.
And the apprentice shall destroy the master.
What a lovely plan.
So it must be.
It feels like I'm back at Imperial Intelligence.
I hear plans like this a lot.
From the start, I hoped your experience would prove useful.
I'm not sure he'd pay me for that.
Seems like bad business.
The reward for following the path of Revan is far greater.
What makes you think I won't betray you, instead?
I might tell him the truth.
You're one of us, now. I put my trust in you, Revanite.
I "obtained" this Sith amulet from Charnus. Give it to Sandor. He'll believe you stole it from his master while among the Revanites. They will turn against each other.
When this is done, though... when you've spoken to Sandor... you cannot return here.
But I thought I was part of the order?
What?
If that is your will, Master... then I obey.
As you wish.
Somehow, I'm not terribly disappointed.
Fine by me.
Sandor must never suspect your true allegiance.
You must walk the path of Revan on your own. The path to power--the path neither Jedi nor Sith.
May the Force be with you. May it make you strong.
Leave me now. You have not earned the right to speak.
